title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 279.14 - Pre-review conference
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 279.14 - Pre-review conference

State Regulations

Staff of the Office of State Review may schedule and direct
the attorneys for the parties, and any unrepresented party, to participate in a
pre-review telephone conference with staff counsel. The purpose of the
conference is to consider the possibilities of settlement, to simplify the
issues, to resolve procedural problems, or to discuss any matters which may aid
in the expeditious disposition of the appeal. In the absence of good cause, the
failure of a petitioner's attorney, or of an unrepresented petitioner, to
attend and participate in a scheduled pre-review conference shall result in
dismissal of the request for review by the State Review Officer. Notes

York State Register September 28, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 39, eff. 1/1/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
